alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Franklin County through 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sontag, or over Sydnorsville, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sydnorsville... Penhook... and Sontag. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
